plants.name: Crocus vernus
plants.description: A small, early spring flowering bulb that pushes up through late winter snow in many temperate regions. Known for its vivid cup-shaped flowers signaling the end of winter.
plants.funFact: Crocus flowers have been used historically to produce saffron, though the true saffron crocus blooms later in autumn.

plants.name: Prunus mume
plants.description: A species of Asian plum that blooms in late winter, with fragrant blossoms that are a cultural symbol in East Asia, marking the coming of spring.
plants.funFact: The ume flower is celebrated in Japan with festivals and is considered one of the first signs of spring.

plants.name: Banksia ericifolia
plants.description: A coastal Australian shrub with striking cylindrical flower spikes, important for local wildlife providing nectar during the Australian summer and early autumn months, still flowering in some regions in February.
plants.funFact: Banksia flowers are rich nectar sources and play a vital role in Australian ecosystems.

plants.name: Magnolia x soulangeana
plants.description: A hybrid magnolia notable for its large, tulip-shaped flowers appearing on bare branches in late winter to early spring before the leaves emerge.
plants.funFact: Magnolias are ancient flowering plants dating back 95 million years, predating bees; early magnolias were pollinated by beetles.
